editorialSummary.text: Contemporary hotel with a restaurant, business center & fitness room, plus free WiFi.

originalText.text:
Despite all the negative reviews I see about this particular Holiday Inn, I had a decent/good experience here.

The Lobby: Lobby was very small. A little out dated but that didn't bother me since I really only care about my bedding situation. For safety, if you are out late at night and come back to your hotel, it requires your room key to scan and enter the lobby.

The Room: The room I stayed in was a single King. The room is very small, basically just fits a bed and the dresser and bathroom. The bed was clean, no stains and the bed was nice and tidy. The bathroom was clean as well, sink and shower were up to par.

The Service: Service was good here. The staff on site at check-in was very nice and was able to get my information down and get me to my room quick. The service for the hotel room (house cleaning) was good as well. I came back to my room the following night and everything was cleaned and made up.

Overall, a 4/5. The room was small but did the job in cleanliness and comfort. Service was good as the staff were friendly and very attentive with any of my needs. Small hotel, but does the job since you really aren't in the hotel most of the days anyways.

originalText.text:
Unsafe for female travelers!!! First off, the hotel was extremely dated and dirty, not living up to the chain’s standards elsewhere in the city. Second,
during first night of my stay, a strange man entered my room at 1am with a key card. I had dead-bolted the door and that was the only reason he didn’t get close to me. The staff, after this horrendous security failure, could not care less. They had no security cameras and were unable to find out who used the key card to enter my room. After agreeing to give me a new room, the manager Justine said until she “investigates” there was nothing she could do. Of course, her investigation yielded no results. She refused to refund me my stay or offer anything other than her half-hearted apologies, saying it’s because I booked through Expedia. Only after I requested the refund again in the lobby where multiple other guests were present did she finally agree to refund me. Truly disgusting experience. Will never return.

Only after I requested the refund again in the lobby where multiple other guests were present did she finally agree to refund me. Truly disgusting experience. Will never return.

originalText.text: I was impressed by this hotel, I have travelled to New York at least 8 times and I could say this one was the best hotel I have ever stayed in Manhattan, despite my previous hotels were always located in Midtown, the rooms had enough space, the fee did not included breakfast but they gave us complementary snacks during the whole day (in the morning, mid evening and in the night), one day they were giving us chocolate chip cookies and these were the most delicious ones of my entire life (not lying). Also the staff is very polite and open to help you as guest. We checked out and we’re able to leave out bags there the entire day and collected just before leaving to the airport which was super helpful to continue exploring the city that last day. I highly recommend.

I highly recommend.

originalText.text: Excellent location and staff. Clean bedding and towels. Free baggage storage. Within easy walking distance to WTC train station. My only real complaint was the poor condition of my room's window curtains. I stayed in a 9th floor balcony room and would happily do so again.

text.text: Excellent location and staff. Clean bedding and towels. Free baggage storage. Within easy walking distance to WTC train station. My only real complaint was the poor condition of my room's window curtains. I stayed in a 9th floor balcony room and would happily do so again.

originalText.text: Great location, but more like Fawlty towers than a holiday Inn, which you can normally rely on.  Virtually everything that could be wrong was wrong....key card didn't work, safe didn't work, blind was off its runners, wet patch on carpet.....and this is on the back of having paid way over the normal rack rate in view of the time of year.  I was moved to a better room....but my stay was already compromised...  The cherry on the cake was when I left, and was asked to lug my bags 3 blocks away and pay 5dollars per bag to store them till my cab came!!  Luckily, after expressing disquiet, and much discussion, I was allowed to leave bags behind reception..   This whole experience nearly spoilt my holiday, if it were not that I like new York so much.   However I will think twice before booking a holiday Inn again.
